meanings.definition: The small, precise, or trivial details of something.
meanings.sent1: She meticulously noted down every minutiae of the experiment in her journal.
meanings.sent2: The detective focused on the minutiae of the crime scene to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The chef's obsession with the minutiae of plating made his dishes look like works of art.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion design, paying attention to the minutiae can make or break a collection.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was so detailed that even the minutiae of the background were captivating.

meanings.sent1: Don't get caught up in the minutiae; focus on the bigger picture.
meanings.sent2: The success of the project hinged on the minutiae of the contract details.
meanings.sent3: The argument escalated over the minutiae of who should take out the trash.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was powerful because she didn't get lost in the minutiae but spoke from the heart.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the landscape was in the minutiae, like the delicate petals of a flower.
